question: Don't give me statistics, Carpenter. I know what I'm talking about. DOORS! Oil that, soldier.
answer: Ah! General Formica. General, the severe food shortage that faces the colony...pains me. The thought of any of my children going hungry... Who's the cutest widdle worker? You are! Yes, you! Don't forget to brush your teeth! Ship 'er out. What steps are you taking to remedy the situation?

question: We are launching a major offensive to expand our foraging territory...
answer: Yes, what else?

question: Please don't worry, your majesty. Leave the worrying to me. As you know, I'm not an ant of half- measures. I don't pussyfoot around. This crisis is my number one priority, and I promise you it's being dealt with swiftly, and decisively.
answer: No snacking between meals! Off you go! Now -- what were we saying?

question: I do not recollect, your majesty. Will that be all?
answer: Yes, General Formica. Carry on, my good man! I don't know what we would do without you.

question: We shouldn't be doing this -- it isn't proper!
answer: I'm the Princess, aren't I?

question: Of course --
answer: And do Princesses do improper things?

question: Of course not --
answer: Then if I go to the worker bar, it isn't improper. Anyway, don't worry. No one will recognize us in our disguises. I'm just a common worker, cooling off after a rough day!

question: You new, kid? Trial membership? Kid, when you join this ant's army, you're in for the full hitch. Are you crazy, kid? They shoot deserters! You just stick by old Barbatus. He'll watch out for you. Whatsamatter, kid? Leave a girl behind? No -- we're going to attack the termites! No such luck. Those dirty terms are five times bigger than us, and they shoot acid from their foreheads! Our platoon has the best assignment of all. We're the first into battle! Superior numbers, kid!
answer: ATTAAAAAAAAACK!!!

question: Over the TOOOOOOOOOOOOO-OP!!! It's too damn quiet. Don't be scared, kid. Barbatus's got yer back.
answer: Light it up! They're here!!!

question: Keep your head down! Don't get all sappy about it!
answer: I love the smell of formic acid in the morning.

question: Hey, slow it down, big boy. You're making the rest of us look bad...How come I haven't seen you around here before?
answer: I'm new...I was born yesterday.

question: Tell me about it.
answer: Nobody told me digging was so much fun! You pick up the dirt, you move it, you pick it up again, you move it again -- lots of repetitions, you exercise the forceps, and the pincers --

question: Mmm, yes, I see what you mean...
answer: Sorry, sir -- I was just having a little chat with my friend --

question: Leave him alone! He's new. I don't know what came over me, talking back like that. I must be going crazy...
answer: Sorry I got you in trouble. But listen, you can share my rations.

question: Are you asking me out to dinner?
answer: No -- I mean yes -- I mean -- if you don't have other plans.

question: No one should have to. Have him brought to me. So this Z...he fancies himself an individual?
answer: Yeah...I mean...well...I don't know, really, sir.

question: Well now you haven't fallen for this silly idea of individuality, have you?
answer: Oh, no, sir!

question: Good. You're a good soldier.
answer: Thank you, sir.

question: So tell me. Where's Z?
answer: I...I have no idea, sir.

question: Okay, son. We know what makes an ant colony strong, don't we? We know that no ant can be an individual. No single ant matters, right?
answer: That's correct, sir!

question: Not that one. Or that one.
answer: No, sir!

question: I swear, we've passed this blade of grass three times. Face it, Z, we're lost! We must have walked halfway across the world by now! How did I get into this mess... What difference does it make...we're both going to starve to death, or get squished, or set on fire... You were right...you were right! Z, it's beautiful!
answer: Muffy, look, party-crashers. You down there, haven't you ever been to a picnic? Poopsie, we know some ants, don't we? Are you related to the Fifth Avenue ants? Just being friendly, Poopsie.

question: Hello? I'm not just "any insect". My mother is the Queen. I'm Princess Bala!
answer: They're Eurotrash, dear. Lunch! A little piece of advice, sport -- bob and weave! Bob and weave!

question: What do you mean?
answer: Well -- like my father used to say -- there's no such thing as a free meal!

question: Oh...my...God.
answer: Muffy! Muffy! Wake up! WHYYYYYYYYYYYYY????

question: Come on, Z.
answer: What's with the bummer attitude?

question: Did you say... Z, we made it!
answer: C'mon in! The nectar's fine! Hey, take it easy! There's nothin' to be afraid of! Yeah, back home, they called me a fruitfly. But here, I'm known as... Superfly.

question: Princess Bala. Good. Where's Z?
answer: He's...he's dead. You don't have to look for him anymore. He was eaten by a praying mantis.

question: It's a shame he died prematurely...I was hoping to kill him myself.
answer: Well you'll never be able to hurt him where he is now. I miss him already.

question: You miss him? Why?
answer: Because...because he's twice the ant that you are. I could never go through with marrying you. I'm -- I'm an individual, and when I get married, it'll be to someone I choose.

question: Your majesty, I'm afraid matters of state keep me from attending the ceremony.
answer: But General -- this tunnel is your baby! You're sure you can't stay ?

question: 'Fraid not, your majesty. Goodbye, your majesty.
answer: Very well, General -- I know you -- all work and no play!

question: Alright, let's move out!
answer: In the name of the colony, I declare this tunnel open! Bala!
